actions.recommendation: Family history of high cholesterol and hypertension, smoker, not exercising, increased waist circumference. Numerous risk factors that need attention.
History of hypertension. Not taking medication prescribed by GP due to side effect of constipation. Advised to monitor and follow up with GP to discuss alternative treatment.
Mild anaemia noted on bloods possibly due to heavy periods. Suggest iron studies and gynae check up.

A waist circumference above 80 in a female is associated with an increased risk of chronic disease such as high blood pressure and diabetes. Try to lose some weight, especially around your abdomen by paying attention to the carbs in your diet and starting to exercise.
Slightly raised cholesterol and strong family history of hyperlipidaemia. Make lifestyle changes as discussed regarding diet, exercise, stress management and stop smoking.
Supplement with vitamin D3 5000iu daily. Recheck levels in 4 months aiming for a level of 50ng/dl. Then can reduce to 1000iu daily.
Pay attention to your nutrition, start exercising and stop smoking to maintain your health.
Discuss alternative antihypertensives with GP as the current prescription makes her constipated.
